content: Policies Lifestyle Education Loans CPF Family Asked by AnonymousAsked on 24 Oct 2018I'm currently paying back my parents $100 monthly for the CPF education loan I took up last time. Should I try to clear this debt faster by repaying a higher sum (eg $200) or continue at a min of $100?I'm not intending to ask my parent to waive away the repayment of loan for me hence I'm here to ask which is a better option. Thank you. Thank you guys in advance! Assuming that lump sum repayment is not an option sadly.9 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (9)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Gabriel LeeLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 07 Jun 2019If the repayment amount incurs interest, then you should consider repaying a higher sum each month so as to clear off the debt as soon as possible to reduce the amount of interest payable. 1 comment2

Lim Zhi CongLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 24 Oct 2018Same boat here. Currently serving NS so won't need to repay. Initially wanted to one shot pay back to clear debt ASAP. But after some thought, I would choose to pay 100/200 per month, the rest will be used for investments. I'm confident of being able to get more than 2.5% returns in my I investments, hence I choose to repay slowly.
This only applies if you are confident that you can beat the interest rates for your loan, if not best is to repay ASAP so that the interest doesn't snowball.
There is no shoe that can fit everyone's feet. In the end the decision can only be made by you. 0 comments1
Huang YixuanLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 29 Nov 2018Yeah try to clear it asap man. Debts are not good. Maybe you can try to cut down on your expenditure?0 comments0

Yong Kah HweeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 24 Oct 2018Like what Gabriel mentioned, if your debt has interest tagged to it, then better to clear ASAP. If there is no interest, then you can either take your time to repay so you can invest your money first, or pay it off soon to return the money to your parents ASAP.0 comments0
